Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SaimaKN
Reviews.Content: lovely little rooms, comfortable beds, spacious enough closets, clean bathrooms - some of the rooms may have been a little too small, but that just made the rooms cozy (not cramped). We arrived at 9:00 a.m. in the morning and since some rooms were empty we were allowed to check -in early even though official check-in time was at noon. Additionally, after a long bus journey from Ephesus, we were ravenous, and the hotel staff welcomed us to enjoy their breakfast (for free). The breakfast on the rooftop terrace is lovely - and there lay out a pretty good spread for breakfast. Location wise - it is just five minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Spohia - just step out of the hotel, walk up the hill for two blocks, turn right and then take a left. The staff were very helpful - they helped us arrange for the Bosphorus Tour and airport transfer on very short notice and when we went to Cappadoccia, Pamukkale and Ephesus for about 3-4 days, they were kind enough to let us store our luggage in their storage room. They were always smiling and happy to be of assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: ljbobcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this place for 2 nights and loved it!!! It was a charming hotel and we found the service excellent especially the hospitality of the night manager, Yilmaz Kekliktepe. My husband and I thank him very much for making us comfortable making us feel like we were at home. Thank you again Yilmaz!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but poor rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: TravelEatSleep1
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Is pretty good, close (about 5 blocks from Blue Mosque) but tucked away so you are not in the middle of the craziness. ROOM/FACILITIES (space, cleanliness, bathroom): Terrible. We had just come from staying in 2 great hotels in our 2 previous cities, and were sadly surprised with what we got at Dara. We checked in and got into our room. Right away we noticed a strong smell of humidity/sewage. It was mainly coming from the bathroom. When we asked the reception to give us a different room, they said they were booked and the only thing they did was to spray a ton of deodorizer. Not only were we frustrated with this issue, but how it was handled by the hotel. They would not acknowledge this as a problem, when in fact they have to know there is an issue with their plumbing because they covered the draining hole in the bathroom (main source of odor) and put plugs on the shower and sink. The man in the reception said next day we would get another room. Off course this did not happen. Unfortunately we had pre-paid the room (for lower rate) so it was though for us to leave. The next day I did find another hotel to move to, but that same day we were changed us to a different room. This one was better. Overall, the hotel has to address this odor issue. Besides this clearly it does not have all the features one would like, such as a real closet (first room did, but second had only a rod and some hooks on the wall that served as a closet) and thicker curtains to block out light (see pics). These smaller deficiencies were not a big deal for us, but the room smell and their service did have a negative impact during our time in Istanbul. SERVICE Based on how they handled the issue with the room, service was poor. I have to say though; the lady at the breakfast was super nice and caring. VALUE Although rates were low, I would not recommend this hotel. In fact, because we thought about changing hotels I did some more searching and found better similarly priced options, some of which unfortunately donâ€™t have the option of being booked through booking.com, orbitz etc. By the way, I agree with trip advisor member GRKMaria in being hesitant to post this review, based on previous unprofessional replies from the hotel to other reviewers. But that is only another example of their poor sense of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: Leon K
Reviews.Content: Hotel is small, but very nice. Placed in very convenient location , is easy to get from airport using public transport, and its just few minutes to get to the old city attractions. Staff is also helpful , when we arrived it was problem with our reservation, but stuff gladly helped us. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: muzzy30
Reviews.Content: The Location was great, within walking distance to the major historical places.,All the staff were very kind and professional.Our room was clean ,comfartable and big enough for two people.The breakfast was delicous and fresh.Dara hotel is good choise for proximity to old city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location, Caring Staff”
Reviews.Author: ali q
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week just about a week ago and had a great stay. I was going to book a name brand hotel to be safe but since we were traveling with our four kids, no other hotel could accomodate us all in one room. When we got to the street I was a bit apprehensive. But after having stayed there, I'm glad we did. The room was a decent size for Europe and especially for the price! The staff is what truly made our trip enjoyable. From the loving lady who hosts the breakfast buffet to the front desk and room service, they went out of their way to make us feel at home and comfortable. Sometimes its the people who can make or break the experience for you and Dara staff made it for us. They even arranged a shuttle for us to the airport with 6 passengers and 8 suitcases for free! The room was clean and so was the bathroom, with only two negatives: our room was at the street level and we could hear everyone talk as they walked by or drive by. Secondly, the bathroom was slightly below the standard an American would expect with a slight weird smell. That is not to say.ot was not clean because it was. If one could overlook these two flaws, their staff and willingness to help made all the difference for us! We would definitely consider staying here again. Actually, technically I guess we stayed there twice already because the last two days of our trip we were planning on going out of Istanbul but decided to enjoy Istanbul the whole week. At that point we considered staying at the Marriott with my rewards points, but decided to extend our stay at Dara.

Reviews.Title: “good service, good location , very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: jaymmy
Reviews.Content: the location was very good. hotel staff very friendly and helpful. the rooms were too small and uncomy

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great bargain”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel2c
Reviews.Content: Even for low season the rate I got for a week at the Dara Hotel was so low that I was a bit apprehensive about what I would find. But from the very beginning when I was met at the airport as promised, I was extremely satisfied with the hotel. My room felt new, had a window looking over the minaret of an old mosque and even a bit of a sea view. I appreciated having a safe in the room, a TV, good light for reading and bathroom towels that were large and thick. The hotel's location is excellent - I walked to all the major tourist attractions, and I'm close to 70. The breakfast buffet is large so while some things didn't appeal to me, there was more than enough that did. But the most outstanding thing about this hotel is the effort the staff puts in to make sure you are happy and well taken care of. Without exception they were friendly and always eager to help. While I was quite happy with my room (24), a tall man or woman might find the space between the shower stall and the toilet a bit snug. Other rooms have larger bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: leopolddaher
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that people who gave bad reviews about this hotel are big fat liars. We were a group of 8 friends and we booked 2 quadruple rooms through the hotel's website for 3 nights in February, the price was unbelievable so I kept telling myself this is a scam and they'll charge us more when we get there, but they didn't. The check in was very easy as the hotel had record of our booking, the lobby is small but stylish, the rooms were bigger than expected, meticulously clean, bathroom amnesties and towels were provided, the heating system was very efficient, everything you could ask for was there. The location of the hotel is PERFECT, in a safe neighborhood 3 minutes walk from sultanahmet square and tram. From there you can connect to all major tourist attractions in the city, even taksim. ( and if you're a party animal and want to stay in taksim area at night don't worry taxis are safe and the ride cost only 20-25 liras even at 4h00 am). The breakfast takes place on the terrace of the 3rd floor, from up there the view is a killer ! So is the breakfast itself ;) finally I need to mention the staff are adorable, they were ready to give help whenever we asked for it , from touristic info to 4h00am band aids ! they made us feel so welcome ! I'd like to wrap up by saying we all strongly recommend this hotel, stay there and you won't regret it! perfect location, perfect price, perfect stay, its your perfect home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “i write to share my opinion about the hotel which is really perfect”
Reviews.Author: tina3676
Reviews.Content: this hotel is just perfect the service is very nice and polite sometimes whe can also have good moment together and jokes are welcome everyday we can hear the mohaden and it is really amazing and to pray you should just walk a little and what else the breakfeast is just awesome and delicious and abla samar is a very warm person and her smile is just beautiful the reception is very good what negative to say there is really nothing to complain because it's just perfect from the terrasse you have really a pretty and colorfoul vieuw of turkey and also i can't deny that the landscape is just attractive it was just perfect and the last day i had tears on my eyes because i knew that i would miss this fabulous place that told me to come back to this wonderfull istanbul and now few days after my comeback to belgium i miss alraedy dara hotel

Reviews.Title: “Well Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julia788
Reviews.Content: It is a well located hotel which makes you reach historical monuments in a few minutes.All staff are polite and ready to help you whenever you need something.Breakfast is served on the terrace.It gives you opportunity to taste turkish fresh food while watching the fantastic view of The Marmara Sea.I would like to thanks to all staff especially the lady is working on the terrace.I really liked the Dara Hotel and will go back there next year with my parents.Donâ€™t doubt while choosing Dara Hotel.You wonâ€™t be regret.

Reviews.Title: “Dara Hotel, A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Afrah94
Reviews.Content: Dara Hotel was among the few great hotels I have stayed at. Its really comfortable and pretty clean & tidy. We had a wonderful time staying there with my family. The services and in general the hotel faculty was really helpful & friendly with us. The breakfast service was pretty good too. In short, it was an ideal spot to stay at with all the main tourist attractions barely on 5-10 mins walk from the hotel. We surely did have a great time there. And if visited Istanbul again, I'd love to stay at Dara again :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: travellersnb
Reviews.Content: Dara hotel is clean and well managed. Photos of some rooms online look larger than they are in reality. Breakfast buffet was not for us....open food in trays and not the most hygienic of set ups. Rooms that had Turkish lanterns were most charming. Hotel is very small and on a difficult street to find and on a hill. Walking distance to blue mosque....no restaurant in this hotel but many around the corner of different streets. We would not stay here again....but in all fairness nothing wrong with this hotel. Clean and well priced. Relative to what we paid 100 euro it was all good.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sergey p
Reviews.Content: I was great experience to spend my all holiday at Dara Hotel.All staff were helpful and ready to help me.:)I checked in hotel in the middle of the night and reception clerk offered us Turkish tea.We were pleased to be wellcomed by this gentleman.In the morning,we had breakfast on the terrace.It was wonderfull experience for us to have breakfast opposite to the Marmara sea.Breakfast was so rich.It was smelling turkish cuisine.I will come back there again.Lastly,the hotelâ€™s location was great.It is located in the central of old city.It made us to reach historical monumets in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Tuneful touch”
Reviews.Author: danzell
Reviews.Content: The staff were pleasant and responsive - service was attentive without being intrusive.Attractive decor, in keeping with the theme of the hotel. The room was a good size with a large en suite, although this does vary from room to room. The beds were comfy and the room was well supplied with the high quality basics. If you are a light sleeper, take some ear plugs to counteract the noisy plumbing and creaky floorboards - inevitable in an older hotel and our only minor criticism.Dara certainly stands out above them in both style and service. We would definitely go again and would recommend it to friends.However Very impressed and pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: AlexeySokol
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that I had a great time in this hotel. it was a family trip for me. conditions of the hotel is really good. first of all, the staff was very friendly.. I must add that the hotel has a great terrace with seaview. it was a big pleasure had a breakfast on view of Marmara sea. The price of hotel is very good. I was very satisfied and absolutely I recommend the Dara hotel with love from Moscow, Russia Alexey

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: piratehunter
Reviews.Content: The hotel personnel has been excellent. We had booked it with a big disciunt, and our rate did not include breakfast. Yet the lady manager was so kind that she offered us breakfast for free. And she was really very sincere! The rest of the staff is really well trained, they let us borrow their laptop to check-in online and printed our boarding passes for free. Thank you! The rooms are a bit small, but impeccably clean and very nicely decorated. It is worth choosing this hotel, first of all for its staff attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly,helpful,great base/location and overall fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: Rachxrx
Reviews.Content: Myself and boyfriend stayed at the Dara hotel in November 2011,for 4 nights. We arrived at 11.50pm and the staff could not have been nicer or more friendly, helping with our bags and showing us to our room and also gave us a quick run through of things to see? The wifi worked perfectly and the room was lovely and clean although not the best view, we didn't mind!the breakfast was lovely and the woman was so friendly and attentive. The only thing we thought could be better was it was a bit noisy,I think this was because there was renovations going on. Overall was great for the price and the staff were so lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all ways!”
Reviews.Author: TreadwellLake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dara in October 2011. We were made to feel so at home. Staff was very helpful with lots of suggestions, directions, etc. Room though small was spotless with excellent bathroom. The terrace has a beautiful view of the harbour and it was so pleasant to sit and have breakfast or an afternoon tea. Location is great, appprox 10-12 minutes from the Blue Mosque or the tram. We cant wait to go back. Thanks Dara for making our stay in Istanbul over the top!

Reviews.Title: “such as the location of a hotel in an excellent”
Reviews.Author: 859Mohammed859
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really excellent... Especially it has vey good place in Ä°stanbul and services was perfect. Hotel' s emloyees friendly, respectfull. also clean was another important point on hotel service. I like your especially breakfast that was so professional and delicious. I think it is good example to recognize Turkish culture and kitchen for foreign people. Ä± suggestion to people try to Dara Hotel. I sure you are satisfacory... happy days...

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful Room in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: tolarjev
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd hotel we stayed in in the Sultanahmet section of Istanbul. High praises for Sebnem Hotel, low for Asmali, almost as good for Dara as Sebnem. I liked the Sebnem location maybe 5% better due to it being on restaurant row, but the Dara is easy to find (matters b/c I am perpetually lost). The staff was always pleasant & helpful. There was a laptop for guest use in the lobby. Breakfast was pretty good & view from terrace is excellent. Had a mosque across the street & nothing makes me happier than listening to muezzins. The room was smallish but very clean & bright (in a cheerful way, no light hindering sleep). Stayed 3 nights & slept well. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dara staff, you're the best!”
Reviews.Author: aloha459
Reviews.Content: We grew so fond of our home away from home with our Istanbul family: mgr. - efficient, charming Engin, breakfast room - beautiful, helpful Semra, front desk - very pleasant & kind Aytaq, Imrullah, Yilmer (sorry if the spelling is not correct). The staff was always ready to assist us with such kindness. The hotel is in a wonderful location for walking or catching the tram to famous sights. Most evenings we enjoyed a bottle of wine up on the rooftop patio with a beautiful sunset & then the lights of old town. We would gladly stay here again & recommend it to seasoned travellers who would appreciate it . Those of you who are demanding & complain about every little thing need to stay home. Thanks so much to all the staff for our delightful 5 day adventure in fabulous Istanbul. We miss you, Pat, Ashley, Angela

Reviews.Title: “F&M's 4 days in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: F_A_V_79
Reviews.Content: Great little 3* hotel. Clean and efficient. Serves free tea/coffee/juice on request. Very convenient (walking wise) to Topkapi Palace (15 mins), Aya Sofia (10 mins) and Blue Mosque (5 mins). Room was cosy but fine for our stay given we were only there to sleep and have breakfast! AC worked a treat. Lovely rooftop terrace to view the sunset and ocean. Staff very friendly, genuine and attentive. Free wireless internet access throughout as well as a laptop to use in reception if required.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wissam H
Reviews.Content: The most important thing is the staff hospitality, assistance and devotion. Special thanks to Engin, Yilmaz, Semra, Mustapha,...... And all. They made us feel like staying at home. The breakfast at the roof is very nice, rooms are clean, location is perfect (walking distance to most historical places). Nothing more is needed. Hopefully our next stay will be there (Istanbul needs more than one week to explore). Wissam - Lebanon

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: mensor f
Reviews.Content: this hotel is number one in sultan ahmet area we liked it we will go back again there. it has nice clean room fantactic breakfast

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: payam p
Reviews.Content: is was very kind and friendly. i will go to stay again there people are very warm i like them

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic....I recommend it highly!”
Reviews.Author: Cecille581
Reviews.Content: The staff are all very friendly, hospitable and available to help/assist the guests. The manager Engin Ezgin is very professional and nice. The rooms are quite small but clean. Very close to the main attractions....just a few minutes walk. Breakfast isn't international but the the fun of having Turkish breakfast added to the charm of Istanbul and the lady at the breakfast room (roof top where one can admire the nice view) is simply great, she's adorable! I higly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a temporary home sweet home in Istanbul. This is the first time I really felt home in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing, bit dingy and a touch of dishonesty”
Reviews.Author: royvince
Reviews.Content: we booked early in the year for 3 nights for late May. Due to airline flight arrangements I contacted the hotel in February to advise our expected arrival would be approx 4.am, and asked did they have an area where we could relax on arrival, or if they had a spare room was an early book in available, or do we need to book in for the prior night to our arrival. We received a reply from the manager advising that if a room was available, we could go straight in, but no guarantee that one would be available. What a great and wonderful gesture which we thanked him for. Two days prior to our arrival we emailed again to see if there were any problems, but no reply received. As advised, we duly arrived at about 4am and were completely unexpected by the night staff, who were somewhat less than cordial. We showed them our emails from the manager re the room availability, but were told - he doesnt work here any more, so it doesnt matter, but we do have a room. The conversation and the general demeanour did not impress us, and as the reception area was a bit dingy, we agreed to stay for the rest of the nighjt as paying customers, but advised we would stay the one night only. As we were about to go to the room, the staff insisted that we pay in advance for 4 nights, and with their attitude we then decided not to stay at all and left the hotel at about 4.30am. Subsequently we received an email from Engin the new manager which did not address the problem between us and the hotel, but lectured us with a set of rules. To cut to the chase, several emails passed between us, and I advised that I considerd the matter closed and requested that he not charge us any fees, which he advised that he had not. On return to Australia we found that following his advise to us no fees were charged we found our credit card was debited at a later date. On contacting him and advising that it may have been an automatic debit, would he reverse it as previously agreed, he said no, i can debit according to rules and i did. Not the way to enhance the hotel to customersafter the problems on arrival! Incidently, following our leaving the hotel we went to the Ibis hotet back towards the airport, where we arrived at about 5.30am, and were warmly welcomed, provided with coffee and after a short wait we had an early book in at accomodation prices not much varied from the Dara, with excellent rooms from a recognised hotel chain, and a shuttle bus into town on a regular basis at a very reasonable small charge. In my 30 years of staying in hotels and motels several times each week with my job I have never experienced such poor reception service nor poor customer relations as at the Dara was able to provide

Reviews.Title: “Super location, wonderful staff,very clean room and bedrooms Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahmadfakih1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, staff very friendly and will go to great lenghts to ensure your stay with them is comfortable and enjoyable.The hotel is located very close to the Blue mosgue,Ayasofya and topkapÄ± place all these place are reached within a short walk.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to istanbul either as a or friend.I stayed here with my friend.The breakfasts are super plenty of choice with fresh fruit and bread every day.The rooms are cleaned everyday and the beds are very comfy.A super place to stey..........

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our trip! Can't wait to come back :)”
Reviews.Author: ladybeetler
Reviews.Content: This fabulous hotel is in the heart of Sultanahmet, about 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque with amazing views of the Marmara Sea. Every staff member goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. The hotel manager, Engin, is also extremely keen to help and provides exceptional service. The breakfast had a lot of variety, was delicious, and eaten on the roof top terrace overlooking the sea. The lady in charge of breakfast, Semra, is gorgeous and makes you feel welcome every morning. We stayed at this hotel initially for 2 nights and liked it so much we extended it to 4. We also came back to Istanbul a few weeks later and stayed again, mainly as we knew we would be welcomed back and that we would have another excellent stay (which we did!) The rooms are clean and comfortable. They are not large, but they are certainly adequate and the views from the rooms are incredible. It's also nice to know that there is actually a double bed! In many hotels we stayed at the "double bed" was just 2 singles pushed together. At the Dara Hotel, there is an actual double bed with beautiful Turkish linen. There is free wifi in the rooms, as well as a laptop downstairs for free use. And never to be taken for granted, the hot water worked every time! The staff make the difference for this hotel though - they are simply brilliant. From airport pickup, to local advice and recommending tours, nothing is too much trouble. Can't wait to come back to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location,excellent staff, beautiful atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: cosef
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dara was an amazing find! We couldn'have been happier! The Blue Mosgue, Aya Sophia, The Grand Bazaar and the Underground Cistem are all within close walking distance. The staff were some of the best we've encountered in any hotel around the world.On arrival they give us a complete briefing on everything and helped us with dining ideas which turned out to be great as well as arranging shuttles for the 5 of us for arrival and departure.The rooftop decks was awesome with an incredible view of the Bosphurus.We enjoyed morning coffe and cakes there upon arrival and anjoyed. Breakfast buffet was excellent as was afternoon tea.We loved it!!!!!!!! THE PERFECT PLACE TO STAY Ä°N Ä°STANBUL

Reviews.Title: “The Dara Hotel worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: Travel4us2011
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a group (grandparents, parents and kids age 13 and 9) to Istanbul for the first time from Canada. We chose the Dara Hotel based on the positive and detailed reviews given by other travelers. And we were not disappointed! Yes, the rooms are small...I am sure they are equally small in most of the boutique hotels in Istanbul. The size of the rooms was really not that important to us as we were rarely in them other than to sleep or shower. As others have said, the rooms are super clean and very modern. There is a lovely rooftop patio that is open 24/7 with self-serve coffee/tea/apple tea - so if you find the room too small, go and hang out up there and enjoy the amazing view of the Bosphorus. We picked up snacks from downtown and did that every afternoon - it was so relaxing and beautiful! The breakfast was fantastic. Three members of our group are quite fussy eaters - and even they filled up with enough breakfast to keep them going for hours. Nutella and super fresh bread, fresh fruit and cheese was definitely popular with the kids! Our daughter fell in love with Samra - she is a wonderful woman, and so attentive to your ever need. We will miss seeing her! Engin, Cetin and the rest of the staff are all very friendly and super helpful. They take good care of their guests - from greeting you with tea/coffee when you arrive, to helping you with your bags when you leave. We had a great experience at the Dara Hotel for the week that we stayed there. We would definitely recommend it to others planning a visit to Istanbul. The location is great - yes, there is a hill....but at the top of the hill you can walk to everything (Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, Archeological Museum, Grand Bazaar)....and if my 70+ year old Mum and our 9 year old daughter can do the hill, so can you :) ! Just remember - pedestrians do not have right of way in Istanbul as you make your way up the street! Finally, the Sokullu Kabab House just up the road is fantastic! We ate there several times.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ahmad64
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews about this hotel before booking it. Overall, our experience matches most of the reviews. Great location and staff but rooms are small. We booked the 5 adult family room but the shower was broken. They moved us to a triple & double rooms the next day. Breakfast was plenty for us and the lady there (Samra) is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4gomadinIstanbul
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at Hotel Dara - first the bad bits though - we were left at the airport as our pick up didn't arrive and the rooms are small. BUT the hotel more than made up for the lack of pick up - drinks were offered as soon as we arrived and they asked us which room we would prefer. The rooms are small but wonderfully clean and the beds are comfortable. The staff are all excellent: friendly and informative. Cetin on reception was great and the lady who does the breakfast is just too lovely for words. Overall a great stay in a very central location. Istanbul is expensive so its best not to take everything at face value - ask what you are paying for. EG: We got charged for peanuts that we had with drinks. Can't wait to go again and will stay at Hotel Dara.

Reviews.Title: “We definitely will go back to this hotel and extremely recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: marcprocbr
Reviews.Content: Great hospitality! We spent 4 nights at Dara Hotel - Istanbul and we don't have a single complain only wonderful compliments. I have never been so well welcome by any other hotel I have been. I have been to good hotels and various places but Turkish people and that hotel were extremely friendly and warm. The hotel is simple and great for travellers looking for a good location, cheap and clean hotel with a VERY friendly staff. We were received with tea and cakes and the receptionist sat down with us and explain everything about Istanbul and what we needed to know for our stay. They offered us tea and coffee and cakes at any time during our stay. Almost everyone in the hotel speaks English and who doesn't speak, are very polite and helpful. The hotel is really well located and we did not need to get public transport or taxis, every important place is walking distance from the hotel. My mother had an accident in the shower, where the box glass broke while she was showering, but they came and cleaned everything straight away. If I come back to Istanbul I won't think about going anywhere else then at Dara Hotel. I am really pleased I've chosen this place. Thanks to all staff that were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “No room at the inn”
Reviews.Author: 737av8tor
Reviews.Content: We had made our reservation via Booking.com after extensive research on this site. I had worked in Istanbul previously and know the city: our trip was to visit Turkish friends. we arrived around 10pm to be met by Engin and told that he didn't have a room for us. The people occupying the room had been involved in an accident and were in hospital. He offered to find us somewhere else for 1 night and move us in the next day. As we were only staying for a short time, Saturday night until Tuesday morning, and he couldn't guarantee that the room would be available the next day, we declined. Engin found us another hotel nearby and had his staff take us there. We were disappointed as we had looked forward to staying at the Dara but we were all caught between a rock and a hard place. Regrettably Booking.com charged me a cancellation fee of â‚¬78 which I am disputing as it utterly unjustified.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad for words.....”
Reviews.Author: henkria
Reviews.Content: Never had a hotel as bad as this one! To be honest this had everything to do with the hotel itself! The staff is very nice and tried to help us.....changed rooms 3 times over but every room was very bad, too small, mold in room + bathroom! no wardrobe! Very noisy from both street noise and other rooms Absolutely NO facilities. To be short about it, we were very happy to check out next morning (booked 7 nights, stayed 1!!!) and found an excellent hotel just 50m. further called Hotel Daphne, a little gem!!!! Please do not stay here if not absolutely necessary!

Reviews.Title: “We will stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: nelsonpm
Reviews.Content: Incredibly near to blue mosque. Everyday we started our walking tour seeing the hipodromus and obelisque, It was stunning to see these places early in the morning and realize that "i am sleepeng just to a few steps from these amazing monuments!!!". The breakfast was the same but you will have at least 15 differents kinds of turkish food to chosse. And of course bread and coffe. They have a pick up service at the airport, it is importat if it is your first visit ti Istanbul. The bathroom is brand new. They offer a laptop for free in the lobby and access to internet (perfect!!!). The wifi worked in the room without any inconveniece.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: elallas
Reviews.Content: Good hotel at the heart of Istanbul. Good rooms but a little bit small and oldies except for the bathroom. Breakfast could be better and a toaster would be necessary. Hotel personnel is kind and help you everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Istanbul highlights”
Reviews.Author: MCharlie71
Reviews.Content: Went to Istanbul from the 18th until the 23rd March 2011 for the 1st time and I selected this hotel mostly because of the reviews I read. I have to rate Excellent for this small hotel and to consider it an excellent choice as an independent traveller. The recepcion guys are very friendly and always willing to give a small help and to chat a bit. The location is simply perfect. A walk from the hotel until the Blue Mosque is 5 minutes. There is a small convenience shop on the top of the street where water and a late snack can be bought. There are plenty of Kebab, restaurants and a Mc Donalds only 10 minutes walking and the tram stop is also some 5-10 minutes walking. Rooms are ok (single) with air conditioned and sattelite TV (over 400 tv chanels). There is wi-fi for free on the lobby. Service is also excellent. Not something fancy or upscale, but I had all I needed (also a small mini-bar). The only "problem" is that there is a mosque on the other side of the street and calls for prayer before sunrise are really loud, but after that I used to sleep a little more. The lady in charge of the breakfast is also a sweet lady. When I was there, a group of noisy French student kids was also there, but she always kind even with a full room. A great value for money on a FANTASTIC city to visit and an excellent location. I also had a free shuttle on the arrival which is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: berzini
Reviews.Content: The tripadvisor rating looks fine, but note that booking.com rating is seriously overrated. The hotel has great location - just 2-3mt walk from Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophya - but otherwise it is quite ordinary. The breakfast is not good to say the least, you can hear people walking/talking in corridors. We also had a rather unpleasnt experience of being moved to a different (although nearby and free taxi provided - besides we arrived at night) hotel for the first night of our booking (the hotel was overbooked). I would not say the management tried hard enough to apologize for this inconvenience. The value (we had a good rate i should admit) and perfect location do make this hotel a good choice for a short stay (1-2 nights) but i would not recommend it for longer periods of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dara Hotel - your home when visiting Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: VisitorToTurkey
Reviews.Content: Location and a friendly staff make the Hotel Dara feel better than home when vacationing in Istanbul. A short walk of just a few blocks to Sultanahmet, Topkapi Palace, and Aya Sofia, make Dara Hotel a perfect Turkish gem with clean, small rooms. Start your day with the rooftop breakfast buffet and take in the impressive view. The breakfast included many items so everyone will find something they love to eat. The hotel also includes an adjacent property with larger rooms designed for families. I throughly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Dara. The hotel include an elevator so moving from floor to floor is never a problem, however, guests with mobility issues will want to make use of taxi services when touring The City since Istanbul is designed for pedestrians.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - lovely friendly staff - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Freolife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dara Hotel in January 2011. We were picked up from the airport as arranged with no problems. Our room was great - small, as everyone says, but clean and comfortable. The bathroom is small but perfectly adequate and sparkly clean. Yes, there is a mosque close by and you do hear the call to prayer, but we didn't really mind this at all. It's part of being in Turkey! The location of the hotel is wonderful - close to everything in the Sultanahmet area and not too far to the train/tram for forays further afield. However, it is the staff that make this hotel special. The guys on the front desk are a wonderful source of information on places to go, how to catch buses, trains etc and will also arrange tours for you if you want them to. They are also very welcoming every time you return to the hotel, providing tea or coffee and chatting about your day. The Turkish pronunciation lessons come free!! The breakfast is great and the lovely lady who runs the breakfast room (think her name is Sabra?) is a treasure. We will definitely return to the Dara Hotel again when we are next in Istanbul - keep up the great work guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a nice location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: jaybark
Reviews.Content: The staff at Dara Hotel was great. We came in and were greeted by a number of staff, we were treated to tea while they checked us into our room (the Turks drink tea more than most people drink water!). A little bit of Turkish and a smile went a long way to making friends with the staff. They were really great. The rooms were small but neat and well furnished. The beds were soft and made for a good nights sleep. The wifi worked well. The one negative you will have for about any hotel in Sultanahmet is the early morning call to prayer. Dara is just across from one mosque and there are a number of others in the area. Really it is a great location. It is just an 8-10 minute walk to the Sultanahmet tram stop. To get to the hotel you walk past Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, through the hippodrome and then it's just up two streets and a short walk down the hill. So for ease of access it is great. The breakfast at the hotel was wonderful. There is a sunroom on the roof with a nice view out towards the Bosporus. There was lots of food and plenty of tea and coffee. It was a great stay and would definitely consider going back on our next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Ok Breakfast, Noisy Mornings”
Reviews.Author: Jambero
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel due to all the wonderful reviews here on Trip Advisor. I booked a standard room online through their reservation system, but was confused whether I actually had a reservation, since the deposit was never charged to my card that I was required to provide. I tried twice to get into the third-party reservation system and it would not allow me. Twice I asked for the password to be sent to me and, again, no dice. So, I ended up having to email my inquiry and got a quick response saying that I indeed did have a reservation. My mistake was not confirming that I had also ordered the shuttle from the airport. Despite ordering the roundtrip shuttle from Ataturk Airport (for an exorbitant $45, however it was convenient) online from the hotel, the shuttle was a no-show at the airport. I called the hotel and the clerk, who's English was limited, seemed to not be able to find my reservation for the room, let alone the shuttle. Eventually, he said the shuttle is on it's way. If I had to do it again, they pick you up for free from the airport, apparently. So, I'd take the free shuttle inbound and take a tram and bus to the airport outbound next time for just a few dollars. My room was ok for the price, I guess, but VERY small. I slept fine, but mornings were noisy, because due to the construction of the hotel itself, it's just clanky and you hear every footstep, other guests' showering, and every room door closing. Breakfast was adequate. Housekeeping didn't clean my room until 6 PM one of three days I was there. The location can't be beat though. I recommend exploring downhill from the hotel and not always uphill. I only learned this my last morning. The front desk seemed rather aloof at times. But, Istanbul's a wonderful town and I had a fantastic time. I'd just look for a different hotel next time.It's just not the gem people say it is.

Reviews.Title: “I want to thank the hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Salmeen
Reviews.Content: Excellent location of the hotel away from the train station and the popular market and the Green Mosque and restaurants ten minutes. Note from the hotel breakfast and the service excellent, room small, there are free online and there are TV

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: SamirSalim
Reviews.Content: I checked in at Hotel Dara with my wife on the 25th of Dec. I arrived early in the morning well before the check in time. Despite this the person at the front desk was very accommodating seeing that we looked very tired from our overnight travel and put us up in a very good room which was spacious and squeaky clean. The bathroom was just as good. The location of the hotel is simply superb in one of the quaint cobbled stone lanes in Sultanahmet area, just a stones throw away from the Blue Mosque. The view from the terrace area where we had our sumptuous breakfast was breathtaking with the sea of Marmara in the background. It's a pity we had to check out the same day as our flight was in the evening. This place is ideal for those who are looking for a simple boutique hotel which is professionally run. Its well and truly value for money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, clean, very very friendly”
Reviews.Author: junenw
Reviews.Content: Our trip didn't start too well, Lufthansa managed to loose 12 cases, so that none of the party had any luggage, then the taxi that had been promised didn't turn up, when we finally arrived we received a warm welcome from the manager and his staff, although no explanation about why we had had to pay for the complimentary transfer. Drinks were offered on arrival, (Turkish Tea, Coffee, juice - beers promised but never materialised) together with a short talk on the best way to enjoy our time in Turkey which was very useful. The rooms were very clean although a touch on the small side, each room had a free safe and an empty mini bar, The Staff were great, the well stocked breakfast room on the terrace gave some stunning views over to the Bosporus after the first morning as soon as you went in the lady in charge knew exactly what you wanted to drink. Mamut on reception spoke excellent English and was able to give some good advice on where to go to eat. Situated within 5/10 minutes of the "Blue Mosque", Sultanahmet Square, The Grand Bazaar, Basilica etc., it is perfectly located. Negatives - only a couple - its right across from a Mosque so you get woken up at 6am by the call to prayer although didn't even hear it after 2nd night, There is no area where you can just sit and relax especially for a large group except in small room just off reception or up on the roof terrace bit too cold in November. Stair case is a marble spiral one which was a bit scary especially when wet.. Street outside is a busy road very uneven cobbled with no pavements - WEAR FLAT SHOES, any with heals will be wreaked in a week. Places to eat/ drink Cheers Bar Akbiyik Caddesi 20, Sultanahmet. Large jug of Beer only 15TL Karadeniz Pide Salonu . Kalyoncukulluk Caddesi No:8 | Beyoglu, just across from Cheers - great food good value, menu clearly explained. Restaurant to avoid Chang Chengs Chinese restaurant at top of street from hotel, service poor, food just about palatable, Charges very high and then 10%service charge added to bill with no explanation or mention on the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Well Located, Nice Rooftop, VERY small rooms”
Reviews.Author: HappyFeet21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights and appreciated the location and the clean condition of the room. The bathroom seemed fairly new and the rooftop had a nice view of the Bosphorous. The staff was very friendly and helpful, they gave us a nice orientation about the area, itinerary suggestions and warnings about the common ways some restaurants or shops might try to overcharge tourists. We had an extremely small room which had a window overlooking an alley that was undergoing construction. I saw a few of the view rooms and they were equally small. I would stay here for sightseeing, but if I were looking to relax in the room a lot then I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was perfect for all our needs.”
Reviews.Author: keithandhelen3
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with big country charm. The rooms were small but conforatable. Thje staff were always there to serve you with a smile and the breakfast on the rooftop was delicious, made more so by the lovely lady who ran the area.. The physical situation of the hotel was perfect, just a few short blocks walk from the major sites of Istanbul.. I would return there if I returned to Istabul and I highly reccommend anybody to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: camanogirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was charming, very clean and the hospitality superb! It was exactly what we were looking for. The manager was wonderful, the staff helpful, and the woman that runs the kitchen took pride in the rooftop breakfast cafe like no other. We would go back to Istanbul and stay here in a heartbeat. The rooms are small, but super-clean and cozy. We could see the mosque next door and the sea beyond from bed! If you want a big suite, go stay at a chain hotel, but if you want something special, stay here. Also, would like to recommend a nice fish restaurant by the name of "Sip Sak." It sounds like Ship Shack and is at the entrance to the fish restaurant area, fairly close to the hotel. Glass enclosed courtyard..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: lazouze
Reviews.Content: I don't have a lot to say about this hotel because my stay there was just A.W.E.S.O.M.E! Super Great location, Super Good Breakfast Buffet, Super Nice Staff and Manager and Super Clean... I would def recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Brilliant Staff, Tiny Room!!!”
Reviews.Author: IK786
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 6 ( 4 kids) and booked a family room for 8 Nights (1 double and 3 single beds). Erhan offered free pick up and drop off to airport as well as a complimentary meal at an excellent restaurant. Erhan and his staff (Haruk, Byram, Mohammed and Samra) were simply fantastic in looking after all our needs. Lots of genuine love given to the children, in particular the little one was spoilt by Byram and Samra. The hotel is very clean and very new, staff come to clean the room and replace towels every day. There is always at least one person if not two at reception to meet your needs. The room has a safe, phone, TV, mini fridge, shower and hair dryer. But no Kettle or cups for tea / coffee. Breakfast was on the balcony with brilliant views of the sea of marmara and included cereal, selection of fresh fruit, selection of bread and various spreads, boiled eggs, fresh orange / cherry juice, tea / coffee, milk for the kids. The location is on a hill, with Sokullu Mosque 30 seconds away which was perfect for me for the early morning and late night prayer. Blue Mosque was 10 mins away - again meaning all the family could go for the sunset prayer every evening. The only two negatives were, no one turned up to pick us up at the airport, but Erhan refunded me the cost of the taxi from the airport to the hotel and also the bathroom was very small (i.e. your head is practically touching the wall when sat on the loo!!! ) I would recommend any young family with kids to use Dara, I will be returning to it next year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place/people - tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: Boydus
Reviews.Content: You cannot fault the hospitality and helpfulness of the staff in this hotel. I was well impressed. We arrive in Istanbul in the pouring rain (the last time I saw rain like that was the Sheffield 2007 floods). A taxi driver couldn't find the hotel (you will find this typical of Istanbul taxis - use trams or buses instead - we started walking to the hotel but the map got ruined in the rain. A local saw we were struggling and invited us in and called the hotel who immediately came to pick us up from the local's house. The breakfast service, or anything we wanted, the hotel arranged. They were brilliant in that respect. The one issue was the room. The hotelier did apologise for the room saying it was the last one they had. It was nice - clean, tidy, nice dÃ©cor. The one issue was the size. The double bed took up most of the room and there was no floor space hardly for anything. The location is ideal, at the bottom of the hill leading to the blue mosque. I do recommend this place, especially for the service. But I think you need to know what you may get is a tiny room.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: wagnerers
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Dara Hotel. The staff were very friendly, and our room was upgraded from a double to a triple. The room was small by North American standards but average for Europe. The breakfast buffet was ok, and the rooftop is quite lovely. The location is good, in that it is minutes from the Aya Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, the Palace and tons of other sites and restaurants. HOWEVER, if you are a young woman who does not want to cover to ankles and wrists (keeping in mind it is 40 degrees celcius out) I do not recommend spending a lot of time in this area, or just have a thicker skin than me! This is based solely on my own experience, I wore sundress that showed no cleavage and cut off at the knee and I was glared at, leered at and received so many dirty looks that it really started to ruin my trip. We did notice that the worst of this was on Sunday, and it wasn't as bad on other days of the week. We stayed in the Sirkeci area for 2 days at the end of our trip and I did not have to deal with a fraction of the same negative attention. In addition, it is a bit of an uphill walk to those attractions from the hotel. Given the warnings about the location, we paid 55 euros a night and at that price I would definitely recommend it and let people make up their own minds

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent Hotel with excellent staff & services..”
Reviews.Author: ambajri
Reviews.Content: We went to Dara Hotel on the 9th of June and it was 6 of us so we stayed in two rooms. Our genius friend was the one who found the hotel and we all praised him for that. The hotel was absolutely fantastic, the location, the services, the staff, even when there was a misunderstanding in terms of airport transportation, the manager "Erhan" was just great and sort it out immediately.. The location is just perfect, right next to everything, and we found out that the "call for prayer" was very useful for us as then we could attend it in the mosque which was so peacful and everyone can go and visit it. The breakfast at the top of the hotel was just another dream, the quality of the food was excellent and the view from the top was superb and so relaxing. Would I recommend this hotel to my friends? Sure I will. In fact I already told all our friends about the great hotel of Dara.. Highly Recommended...

Reviews.Title: “A nice, friendly little hotel”
Reviews.Author: STLMomChicago
Reviews.Content: What I liked about Dara Hotel: It was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was good. The location is excellent, close many sights and a tram stop. The air conditioning works very well. It was small, so I felt comfortable letting my kids go alone from floor to floor to visit relatives in other rooms. What wasn't so great: I could never get the wi-fi working in my room, only in the lobby. The sights are nearby, but you do have to walk up a steep, narrow street. The elevator is tiny; even an umbrella stroller might not fit. Call to prayer was loud, although we got used to it. There are shops nearby to get drinks and snacks. The kebab restaurant up the street was quite good, and the Chinese restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: midgeo
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and location for a budget hotel! We stayed 6 nights in the Dara Hotel at the end of June. The hotel is a few blocks off the Hippodrome in a quiet neighborhood. We felt safe walking to and from the hotel at night â€“ just had to be mindful of the cobblestones and sidewalks. The hotel has been renovated fairly recently, and it was spotlessly clean. The double and triple rooms we saw seemed very nice. Our twin room, however, was really tiny (could not walk around the beds at all), and looked into an enclosed service area and the fire escape. We often got cigarette smoke drifting in, but we donâ€™t know where it came from. The room was well-soundproofed (with AC) and very quiet. The staff was friendly and tried to be helpful (if not always successful). English is a bit limited, and our Turkish is non-existent! Weâ€™d definitely recommend this hotel to someone who doesnâ€™t need a twin room!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Shylafit
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on a 20-day trip to Turkiye. We had confirmed it after much searching through the portals of 'tripadvisor' and were we glad we did. The hotel was small and extremely personal. Our room although small and the bathsroom even tinier, everything was spotlessly clean. The window, with lovely red geraniums in window boxes, opened out onto the street, overlooking a mosque across the street. Haluk at the reception, is an absolute gem. The entire staff was warm but he just went that extra mile to make us feel at home...from chatting with us and regaling us with stories about local life, to directing us on where to go, suggesting ways to spend a romantic evening, to providing us with a local converter that would fit our gadgets and keep the batteries charged, he just took care of it all. The hotel being located in the old historic part of Istanbul, was within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, The Grand Bazaar and to reastaurants catering to different pallettes and budgets. The breakfast was excellent, with a variety of fresh and dry fruit, fresh tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, cheeses, yogurt and breads all served on the terrace, lined with geraniums and with a view of the sea in the distance. The only drawback, as we saw it, was the hotels proximity to the Mosque which ensured an early morning wake up call with the extremely loud 'call to prayer'. Sleeping in was simply out of the question. We considered ourselves extremely lucky to have chanced upon this hotel to which we will definitly return if we ever get a chance to go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JonGoHols
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - service excellent, breakfast food very good, exceptional value. Location in old town great but only downside is the calling to prayer at 5 a.m. in the morning that can be heard in the hotel. As the call to prayer is from every mosque this issue is probably common in many locations in Istanbul and only lasts ten minutes so after the first night was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hsmukler
Reviews.Content: First time to Istanbul and our hotel was perfect for what we wanted which was a good value that was safe and near all the attractions. Reasonable walk to the metro stop, quiet but very safe street, excellent breakfast, very responsive staff, I had a broken shower which was fixed immediately and a cable problem also fixed on the spot. Wish there were more English TV stations, also lack of closets bugged my partner, but not me. 5a.m. call to prayer outside our window was an irritant, but part of the experience. Really good value, it was nice to have one place in Istanbul where I didn't feel constantly hustled. Got good airport pickup and return.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: OregonFlower
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotels.com and only needed one night as we were just back to Istanbul before flying home. The staff was professional and treated us very well even though we just had the least expensive room they have. Room was very good--all updated with a wonderful modern bathroom and new bed and linens. Room was very small but this is common in Istanbul and we have encountered that before. Everything worked in this room which is something we have often not encountered in Istanbul. It is a great location near all the old stuff and the breakfast is very wonderful--a buffet on the rooftop including lots of good eats and a view!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE. PERFECT LOCATION. GREAT HOSPITALITY!!”
Reviews.Author: Edeng01
Reviews.Content: Located in the Sultanmhet this hotel is within easy walking distance of St Sofia. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated. The food iand service is level is high and the cost is reasonable. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Short Istanbul Break”
Reviews.Author: JandJLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, with very friendly staff and spotlessly clean rooms. The room we had was rather small, but who cares for a few nights. The bed was comfy, the room was quiet, the shower was hot and they served lovely buffet breakfasts. Unfortunately it was too cold when we were there to breakfast outside on the roof terrace, but there is a fine view over the Bosphorous and it would be lovely to breakfast outside in warmer weather. The hotel is in a good area within easy walking distance of the main sights. The rates are excellent and we would thoroughly recommend this hotel. We came in via Sabiha Gokcen Airport, which is quite a way out of the city. We booked a shuttle on-line to and from our hotel. It is only 10 Euros per person each way. They meet you at the airport with a name sign and drop you off at your hotel, then pick you up to go back. Very efficient and friendly. http://www.istanbulairportshuttle.com/sabiha-airport-info.php

HotelInfo.Name: Dara Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Kucukayasofya Mah.Su Terazisi Sk, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
